'What a beautiful song, [placeholder]. Yes, I remember it now. The rivers and the streams shall cloud the minds of those who hate, but those who have kindness in their hearts will always find their way.'
You listen closely and hear part of a song

Bring the song to Radagast and <rgb=#00FF00>sing</rgb> it for him
Radagast needs your assistance in protecting Rhosgobel so that it will remain safe even when the Wizard is elsewhere in Middle-earth.
You listen closely and hear part of a song
You listen closely and hear part of a song
You forgot to notate the music you heard
Examine the waters around Rhosgobel ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Radagast
This is a nice quiet place to stop and <rgb=#00FF00>listen</rgb>
This is a nice quiet place to stop and <rgb=#00FF00>listen</rgb>

'It is just speculation, of course it is. It may be nothing. Let us hope it is nothing!

'But for now, I need to work a magic of protection in order to keep safe my home of Rhosgobel and all of Laerlad while I am away. There is a calm in the woods now; do you hear it? There used to be an old song in these woods, a song that I heard once but have now forgotten. It was sung by all the rivers and streams here in Laerlad, but now it has gone into hiding. If you listen closely enough in the quiet woods you might hear it.

'It was a song of protection, of course it was. I can remember its name, Tauralindalë. If it were to be sung again, perhaps it could keep Laerlad and Rhosgobel well hidden from danger.'
<rgb=#00FF00>Listen</rgb> for the fourth fragment of Tauralindalë
Radagast can be found at Rhosgobel.\n\nYou should talk to Radagast.
<rgb=#00FF00>Listen</rgb> for the fifth fragment of Tauralindalë

Tauralindalë may be hiding in and around the waters of Laerlad.\n\nYou should <rgb=#FF0000>listen</rgb> around the waters of Laerlad for the song of Tauralindalë.

You write down the fragment of the song you hear
'Of course it worked, my friend! You see the waters shimmering? That is the true gift of the waters. It is the gift that will fool hate and spread kindness throughout the forest.'
You write down the fragment of the song you hear

'Apa i vinya luina sír sirë'
'Sirë olla cemen, sirë olla ondo'
'Nén, tercáno cuiviëva ceutana!'
